review_blob: From the bottle, pours a dark coppery blonde colour with a thin, white, lasting head. Fairly subdued fruity aroma with some caramel and resiny tones. Tastes roughly bitter, earthy and resinous with some fruit (pineapple, mango, passionfruit) and a hint of caramel. Certainly less fruity than the HBC, but still fairly fruity. Aftertaste is long and bitter, but smooth; not overpowering, but you certainly notice it. Fruit notes are soon lost, but the earthy resin flavours are retained, along with the bitterness. Moderately strong carbonation.

Pours clear, pale orange form the bottle with a very thin white head. Minor lacing. Aroma is orange, grapefruit, generally citrus with hints of caramel, also slightly earthy hints of almost pine or resin. Tastes boisterously bitter with powerful citrus flavour; oranges, passion-fruit and lots of hops. Slightly sour, but with sweet fruit notes and again a hint of caramel. Fairly soft, but noticeable carbonation. Aftertaste is fruity with pineapple, mango, much less of the orange; tastes similar to Punk IPA with more fruit. Fairly dry with a long bitter, slightly oily, aftertaste.

Powerfully bitter, very fruity with strong citrus flavours, incredible citrus aroma. Would drink again.
